column2: (angrily) That\xc2\x92s like the tenth time I\xc2\x92ve peed since I\xc2\x92ve\nbeen here!'
That\xc2\x92s also like the tenth time you told us.'

Yeah, oh I\xc2\x92m sorry, it must be really hard to hear! I tell ya,
it\xc2\x92s a lot easier having three babies play Bringing in the Noise, Bringing in da Funk
on your bladder! I\xc2\x92m so sick of being pregnant! The only happiness I get is from a
cup of coffee, which of course is decaf, \xc2\x91cause\xc2\x97Oh! I\xc2\x92m pregnant!'
Pheebs, did\xc2\x85you want a cookie?'
(starting to cry) Thank you so much.'
So uh, Pheebs, honey, how are those mood swings coming?'
I haven\xc2\x92t really had any yet.'
Hey guys!'
Hey.'
Hey!'
All right, here\xc2\x92s the ring. (Shows Chandler the wedding ring he plans\non giving Emily) '
(shocked) Yes! Yes! A thousand times, yes!'
So uh, any ideas for the bachelor party yet?'
Whoa-whoa-whoa! Before you start handing out wedding rings and planning\nbachelor parties, don\xc2\x92t you have to decide who your best man is gonna be?'
Oh, it\xc2\x92s awkward. It\xc2\x92s awkward. It\xc2\x92s awkward.'
I sort\xc2\x92ve already asked Chandler.'
What?! He got to do it at your first wedding!'
Joey, I figured you\xc2\x92d understand. I mean, I-I\xc2\x92ve known him a lot\nlonger.'
Come on Ross! Look, I-I don\xc2\x92t have any brothers; I\xc2\x92ll never get\nto be a best man!'
You can be the best man when I get married.'
(pause) I\xc2\x92ll never get to be a best man!'
(to Chandler) Wait-wait, so, you get to be my best man twice and I never\nget to be yours at all?'
Oh no-no-no, you\xc2\x97yeah, of course you get to be my best man.'
(impatiently tapping Chandler on the shoulder) What about me?! You-you\njust said I could!'
I\xc2\x92m not even getting married! Okay, this is a question for\nscience fiction writers!'
I can\xc2\x92t believe you\xc2\x92re not picking me.'
Hey, how can it not be me?!HeyHey!'
I\xc2\x92m not even\xc2\x85 I\xc2\x92m not even\xc2\x85'
Fine, y\xc2\x92know what, that\xc2\x92s it. From now on, Joey, I want you to\nbe my best man.'
Yes! (to Chandler) Shame about you man.'
(to her babies) Stop it!'
What?'
One of the babies is kicking.'
I thought that was a good thing.'
It\xc2\x92s not kicking me, it\xc2\x92s kicking one of the other babies. Oh\n(looks down her dress)! Don\xc2\x92t make me come in there!'
(entering) Hey!'
Hey!'
Do you guys have like a big bowl I can borrow?'
Yeah, there\xc2\x92s one right under the cabinet. '
(grabs it) Thanks.'
Why do you need it?'
Oh, we\xc2\x92re having a big party tomorrow night. Later! (Starts for the\ndoor.)'
Whoa! Hey-hey, you planning on inviting us?'
Nooo, later. (Walks out the door.)'
Hey!! Get your ass back here, Tribbiani!! (Joey walks back in, scared.)'
Hormones!'
What Phoebe meant to say was umm, how come you\xc2\x92re having a party\nand we\xc2\x92re not invited?'
Oh, it\xc2\x92s Ross\xc2\x92s bachelor party.'
Sooo?'
Are you bachelors?'
Nooo!'
Are you strippers?'
Nooo!'
Then you\xc2\x92re not invited. (Starts for the door again.)'
All right fine! You\xc2\x92re not invited to the party we\xc2\x92re gonna\nhave either.'
Oh-whoa, what party?'
Well umm\xc2\x85'
The baby shower for Phoebe!'
Baby shower. Wow! That sounds sooo like something I don\xc2\x92t want to do!\nLater! (Finally, he makes his exit.)'

I can\xc2\x92t believe I\xc2\x92m gonna have a party! This is so great!\n(Really excited) A party! (Really, really excited) Yay!! (Suddenly, she starts crying and\nRachel moves to comfort her.) I don\xc2\x92t know why.'
This is what I\xc2\x92ve got going for the party so far, liquor wise. Get a\nlot of liquor.'
Great. Great.'
Okay, now uh, in terms of the invite list, I\xc2\x92ve got you, me, and\nChandler and I\xc2\x92m gonna invite Gunther \xc2\x91cause, well, we\xc2\x92ve been talking\nabout this pretty loud.'
I\xc2\x92ll be there.'
All right\xc2\x97oh! Listen, I know this is your party, but I\xc2\x92d really\nlike to the number of museum geeks that are gonna be there.'
Yeah. Tell ya what, let\xc2\x92s not invite any of the anthropologists, only\nthe dinosaur dudes!'
Okay! We\xc2\x92ll need a six-pack of Zima.'
(entering) Hey guys, what are you doing?'
Oh, just planning my bachelor party with my best man.'
Yeah, well, good luck trying to top the last one.'
Yeah, see, I don\xc2\x92t think it\xc2\x92s gonna that difficult considering\nthis one won\xc2\x92t be taking place in the basement of a Pizza Hut.'
Oh, I\xc2\x92m Ross. I\xc2\x92m Ross. I\xc2\x92m too good for the Hut;\nI\xc2\x92m too good for the Hut.'

Look, I gotta go pick up Ben. Everything so far sounds great Joey, just\nremember to keep it on the mellow side, okay? Just a couple of guys hanging out playing\npoker, no-no strippers or anything okay?'
You got it.'
Okay, see ya later.'
See ya. (Ross exits, and Chandler moves over next to Joey, laughing.)\nHave fun planning your mellow bachelor party.'
Well, there\xc2\x92s gonna be strippers there. He didn\xc2\x92t say anything\nabout no strippers.'
He just said, "No strippers."'
Oh, I chose not to hear that.'

Look what I got! Look what I got! Look what I got! (She shows Rachel\nwhat she bought. She bought a little leather jacket and a little cowboy outfit for the\nbabies.) Can you believe they make these for little people?'
Little village people.'
Okay, look at this one. This is my favourite. (It\xc2\x92s a little pink\nand white dress for the girl baby.)'
Oh, that is so sweet!'
I know! Phoebe is gonna love dressing them in these!'
Huh. Except, Phoebe\xc2\x92s not gonna be the one that gets to dress them.'
Because she\xc2\x92s not gonna get to keep the babies.'
Oh my God! We are throwing the most depressing baby shower ever!'
Wait a minute! Unless, we give her all gifts she can use after\nshe\xc2\x92s done being pregnant. Like-like umm, regular coffee, Tequila.'
Oh, and somebody can get those leather pants she\xc2\x92s always wanted!'
Oh, she\xc2\x92s gonna love that!'

What the hell is this?! What, did you actually thought it would make me\nfeel better to give me stuff that I can\xc2\x92t use for another two months?! This sucks!\nAll right, what\xc2\x92s my next present?!'
Hey listen man, about the stripper\xc2\x85'
Yeah?'
Good call!'
(banging a spoon against his beer bottle) Okay, a little announcement,\na little announcement. I\xc2\x92ve decided that my best man is, my best friend Gunther!'
What\xc2\x92s my last name?'
Central Perk?'
(to Ross) Thanks for not marrying Rachel. (He starts to leave.)'
Oh-whoa-wait, Gunther don\xc2\x92t-don\xc2\x92t forget your shirt. (He gives\nGunther his shirt and Gunther leaves.)'
Hey-hey, what are those?'
Oh, little party favours, check it out! (It\xc2\x92s a shirt that reads,\n"Ross Geller, Bachelor Bash 1998")'
Wow! Yeah!'
Oh-oh! (Shows him what\xc2\x92s on the back, "Best Man Joey Tribbiani,\nwith a huge picture of him.)'

(banging on the bottle again) Okay, okay, a little announcement, I\njust want everyone to know that the position of my best man is still open! And uh, (to the\nstripper) so is the position of the bride.'
Great!'

Smooth man. Yeah, you got some chilie on your neck. (Chandler checks and\nruns into the bathroom.) Well, I just want to say, thanks everyone, this-this was great.\nAnd hey! See you guys Monday morning. (They museum geeks wave at him.) Thanks Joey.'
Oh, hey, don\xc2\x92t forget your shirt.'
Oh, thanks! (Takes it and throws it back into the box and leaves.)'

Okay, hey, museum geeks, party\xc2\x92s over. Okay. Wave bye-bye to the nice
lady. There you go. Back to your parent\xc2\x92s basement. All right. (The museum geeks exit
and Joey unlocks his door and lets the chick and the duck out.) Come on boys, come on out!
Here you go. All right.'
Ohhh, look at the little birdies! Are those yours?'
Yeah!'
Wow, I didn\xc2\x92t know they let you keep chickens and ducks as\npets.'
Oh yeah-yeah. And I got the duck totally trained. Watch this. Stare at the\nwall. (The duck complies.) Hardly move. (The duck complies.) Be white. (The duck\ncomplies.)'
You are really good at that. So uh, I had fun tonight, you throw\none hell of a party.'
Oh thanks. Thanks. It was great meetin\xc2\x92 ya. And listen if any of my\nfriends gets married, or have a birthday, or a Tuesday\xc2\x85'
Yeah, that would be great. So I guess umm, good night.'
Oh unless you uh, you wanna hang around.'
Yeah?'
Yeah. I\xc2\x92ll let you play with my duck.'
Hey, (realises he doesn\xc2\x92t know her name.) stripper! (He notices that\nthe ring box is open, so he picks it up, sees it\xc2\x92s empty and starts to panic.)'
(running and banging on Chandler\xc2\x92s door) The stripper stole the\nring!! The stripper stole the ring!! Chandler! Chandler, get up! Get up! The stripper\nstole the ring!'
(opening the door) What?'
The ring is gone!'
Ugh. Just a sec, give me a minute to wake up for this\xc2\x97Ah-ha-ha!!\nYou lost the ring! You\xc2\x92re the worst best man ever!'
Dude, this isn\xc2\x92t funny! What am I gonna do?! I go to bed last night,\neverything\xc2\x92s cool! I wake up this morning, the stripper\xc2\x92s gone and the ring is\ngone!'
You slept with the stripper?'
Of course!! (Shrugs.)'
Hi, guys.'
Hi! Phoebe. (Both Monica and her try to move out of Phoebe\xc2\x92s way.)'
Hi Phoebe.'
I-I wanted to apologise if I\xc2\x97y\xc2\x92know seemed a tad edgy\nyesterday at my shower. Y\xc2\x92know it\xc2\x92s just the hormones, y\xc2\x92know.'
No we\xc2\x85'
Hormones.'
\xc2\x85hormones, yeah.'
Anyway, I just wanted to say thank you, it was just, it was so sweet.\n(She goes to hug them and they both flinch, thinking that Phoebe is about to attack them.)'
Wow, you seem to be doing so much better. That\xc2\x92s great. So how-how\nare things going?'
Good. Y\xc2\x92know\xc2\x97no-no, okay, it\xc2\x92s-it feels like\neverything\xc2\x92s been about me lately, so what\xc2\x92s happening with you?'
Oh, well, actually we were just talking about me not going to\nRoss\xc2\x92s wedding.'
Oh!'
It just might be too hard, given the history and all that\xc2\x85'
Wow! This reminds me of the time when I was umm, living on the street\nand this guy offered to buy me food if I slept with him.'
Well, h-how is this like that?'

Well, let\xc2\x92s see, it\xc2\x92s not. Really, like that. Because, you see\nthat was an actual problem, and uh, yours is just like y\xc2\x92know a bunch of\ny\xc2\x92know high school crap that nobody really gives y\xc2\x92know\xc2\x85'
(starting to cry) I\xc2\x92m-I\xc2\x92m sorry, I just thought that\xc2\x85'
Alrighty, here come the water works. (Rachel starts crying harder.)'

Ugh! I don\xc2\x92t know what I\xc2\x92m going to do! I called the company\nthat sent and th-they don\xc2\x92t care! Then I called 9-1-1 and they laughed at me, if this\nisn\xc2\x92t an emergency, then what is?'
(entering) Hey guys!'
Hey!'
Hey\xc2\x85'

I just wanted to thank you again for last night, what a great party! And\nthe guys from work had a blast. Y\xc2\x92know, one of them had never been to a bachelor\nparty before. Yeah! And-and another one had never been to a party before, so\xc2\x85'
So uh, hey, that uh, that wedding ring, huh? Man, that\xc2\x92s nice!'
Yeah, right!'
I was uh, I was thinking I might want to pick one of those babies up for\nmyself, I might want to get one of those\xc2\x85'
That ring? When my grandmother first came to this country, that ring and\nthe clothes on her back were all she had with her.'
So you might say, the ring is irreplaceable? (Gives Joey a little\nsqueeze.)'
Oh absolutely! It has been in my family for generations, and every bride\nwho has worn it has had a long and happy life.'
So you might say, it\xc2\x92s a magic ring.'
(laughs, softly) Yeah, the stripper stole it.'
My-my ring? My-my wedding ring? The-the stripper stole my wedding ring?!\nH-how?! How could this all happen?!'
Well, I think it all started when you said, "Hey Joey, why\ndon\xc2\x92t you be my best man."'
(dialling the phone) All right-all right, fine! I-I\xc2\x92m gonna call the\ncops!'
Dude, I screwed up, you don\xc2\x92t have to turn me in!'
Not on you! On the stripper!'
Oh, yeah, well I already did that! They said they\xc2\x92re gonna look into\nit right after they solved all the murders.'
Okay, well, we\xc2\x92ll call the company that sent her!'

I did that too! They wouldn\xc2\x92t give me her real name or her number.\nThey said, "If I bothered them again they\xc2\x92d call the police." I said,\n"If you talk to the police, you tell them I\xc2\x92m missing a ring!"'
So what, Joey? Wh-wh-what? What are you telling me? That there\xc2\x92s\nnothing we can do? Well, how could this happen?!'
Look Ross, I am so-so sorry. I-I-I\xc2\x85'
Well, what if we just ah, called her, used a fake name, and had her\ncome to my office?'
Oh, that sounds like fun, but we\xc2\x92ve got a ring to find!!'
Here\xc2\x92s your tea Phoebe. (They give it to her and quickly take a\nstep back.)'
(sips it) It\xc2\x92s so good. (Monica and Rachel breath a sigh of\nrelief.) Oh, thanks.'
Good.'
I\xc2\x92m so glad you liked it.'
(sets the cup down) Oh! (Grabs her stomach in pain.)'
What?!'
What?! She made the tea! (Points to Monica.)'
Oh! No, I-I think I just had a contraction.'
You what?'
Oh my God!'
Yeah, I thought I had one a couple of minutes ago, and now I know that\nwas definitely one.'
Wait, you can\xc2\x92t have the baby here! I mean I haven\xc2\x92t\nsterilised it since the guys moved out!'
Okay. It\xc2\x92s okay. We\xc2\x92re gonna be okay. Y\xc2\x92know what?\nIt\xc2\x92s okay. I\xc2\x92m gonna, I\xc2\x92m gonna, I\xc2\x92m gonna boil some water and just\nrip up some sheets!'
No. It\xc2\x92s all right; it\xc2\x92s probably false labour. They said\nthat, that can happen near the end, just somebody get the book.'
Rachel, get the book! The book!'
Okay! (Runs and grabs a book and hands it to Monica.) Okay! Here!'
The Bible?!'
I don\xc2\x92t know!'

All right, okay, this is great, uh, Chandler, you get behind the desk.
And-and when she comes in hopefully, she won\xc2\x92t recognise you because, well, why would
she? Uh, okay, and then you buzz Ross and I. (to Ross) You be Mr. Gonzalez, and I\xc2\x92ll
be uh, Mr. Wong.'
Diverse.'
Did anybody call for security?'
(to Ross) You be cool. (He opens the door and lets her in as they all\nturn there backs on her.)'
Okay, which one of you guys is Gunther Central-Perk? (Sees Joey.)\nHey, Joey?'
Where\xc2\x92s my ring? My dead grandmother\xc2\x92s wedding ring? Where is\nit? Where is it?'
Way to be cool, man.'
What\xc2\x92s he talking about?'
There was a ring, in a box, on my nightstand, after you left, it was gone!'
Wait, you guys think I stole some ring?'
We know you took so just-just save yourself the time and confess!'
Okay, who are you? The Hardy boys? Look, I don\xc2\x92t need to\nsteal some stupid ring, all right? I make $1,600 a week doing what I do; any of you guys\nmake that?'
Marry me. (Both Ross and Chandler hit him.)'

I don\xc2\x92t get it! It was in my room all night! And if she didn\xc2\x92t
take it, and I didn\xc2\x92t take it; and you (Chandler) didn\xc2\x92t take it, then who did?
(The duck quacks.) Shh! We\xc2\x92re trying to think! (Ross and Chandler realise it at the
same moment and stare at Joey, who doesn\xc2\x92t get it. After a short pause, with the duck
still quacking, Joey figures it out and starts pointing at the duck.)'
I still don\xc2\x92t get how you know when it\xc2\x92s false labour.'
Well, do you see any babies?'
How do you feel?'
Okay, I guess. I mean\xc2\x85 I don\xc2\x92t know, it\xc2\x92s just, I guess I\nknow it\xc2\x92s going to be over soon.'
Well, isn\xc2\x92t that a good thing? You said you were sick of this.'

I know. It\xc2\x92s just y\xc2\x92know usually when you\xc2\x92re, when\nyou\xc2\x92re done with the pregnant thing, y\xc2\x92know, then you get to do the mom thing.\nI\xc2\x92m gonna be y\xc2\x92know, sitting around in my leather pants, drinking Tequila.'
Some moms do that.'

Okay that\xc2\x92s even sadder. Look, I know, I know what I got myself
into, it\xc2\x92s just that now that they\xc2\x92re in me it\xc2\x92s like, it\xc2\x92s like I
know them y\xc2\x92know, I mean-I mean, it\xc2\x92s just not gonna be easy when these little
babies have to go away.'
Aww, sweetie, but it\xc2\x92s not like you\xc2\x92re not gonna have\nanything. You\xc2\x92re gonna have nieces and nephews, and some ways that\xc2\x92s even\nbetter.'
Yeah, okay.'

No, really. Really, Pheebs, you\xc2\x92re not gonna be the one worrying\nabout saving for college, or yelling at them when they\xc2\x92re bad, y\xc2\x92know, or\ndeciding to put them on Ritalin when they just won\xc2\x92t calm down. Y\xc2\x92know?'
I mean, you\xc2\x92re the one they\xc2\x92re gonna come to when they wanna\nrun away from home, and the one they talk to about sex.'
And you just get to be cool Aunt Phoebe!'
Cool Aunt Phoebe. I am pretty cool!'
Yeah.'
And y\xc2\x92know what else, oh my God, are they gonna love you.'
They are gonna love me.'
Oh!'
Thanks you guys! Again.'
Oh, sweetie! (They all hug.)'
You\xc2\x92re the best. Thanks. Oh! '
Just kidding. Ahh!'
What?!'
Oh my God!'
Got cha again, you guys are so easy.'
If anything should happen to him\xc2\x85'
Joey! The vet said it\xc2\x92s a simple procedure.'
So! Things can go wrong! You don\xc2\x92t know! What if he doesn\xc2\x92t make\nit?!'
He will, Joe.'
Yeah, but what if he doesn\xc2\x92t? He\xc2\x92s such a good duck.'
I\xc2\x92m so worried about him, y\xc2\x92know?'
(coming in from surgery) Somebody lose a ring?'
Oh my God! Thank you! Thank you so much! (He grabs the ring, kisses it,\nand then does a double-take realising where it\xc2\x92s been.)'
H-h-h-how\xc2\x92s the duck?'
He\xc2\x92s doing just fine, he\xc2\x92s resting now, but you can see\nhim in a little bit.'
Ohh, great! Oh hey, listen Ross, thanks for being so cool about this.'
No, that\xc2\x92s all right.'
No, it\xc2\x92s not. I mean you-you made me your best man and I totally let\nyou down!'
Hey, come on, it\xc2\x92s not your fault.'
Yeah, it is! You wouldn\xc2\x92t have lost the ring, right? Y\xc2\x92know\nwhat, Ross you were right from the start, he (Chandler) should be your best man.'
No, you should.'
Now, don\xc2\x92t argue with me\xc2\x85'
Hey! Hey! Hey! I get to choose my best man, and I want both you\nguys. '
Really?'
Really?'
Hey, both you guys should be up there with me. I mean, you two are-are\nmy\xc2\x85 I mean, I\xc2\x92m lucky to have just one good\xc2\x85 (They all start getting\nemotional.)'
Thanks man.'
(starting to cry) I gotta go check something over here. (He walks away so\nthat they can\xc2\x92t see him cry.)'
What a baby.'
Total wuss!'
